column4: Is this the wrong place to ask about a comparison between Ubuntu and Open Suse? (New Linux user on Ubuntu)
SuSE IIRC is still RPM based. rpm left a bad taste in a lot of people's mouths, but ymmv
rpm and apt are two package management tools. You'll probably never notice them as a user but if something breaks, rpms are neigh impossible to fix
care to say why...thats really what I'm looking for and I am not experienced
yeah, its apt underneath the pretty pictures tho. And from my perspective, when I bork something up majorly its way easier to fix than rpm dependency hell. Hopefully you'll never know it exists
I'm hardly unbiased though, I run gentoo for fun and I loathe redhat :)
oh yes another version I'm heard of
I'm a real knoob  but I'm so VERY impressed with Ubuntu
I'm not a n00b at all and _I'm_ impressed with Ubuntu :-D
they've done a great job taking the weapons-grade debian power and putting a candy coating on it
lol Indeed it was a killer for me as Itried over the years
the pain doesn't happen until you get it all set up and then some well-meaning app changes it all back to defaults.....
